prompt: ### Human: how does two factor authentication work?### Assistant:
system:
Two-factor authentication (2FA) is a security process that requires two different methods to verify a user's identity.

In 2FA, a user must provide two different pieces of evidence to log in to an account or perform a transaction. The first piece of evidence is typically something the user knows, such as a password or PIN code. The second piece of evidence is typically something the user has, such as a physical security token or a mobile phone.

When a user tries to log in to an account or perform a transaction, they enter their username and password as usual. Then, they are prompted to provide the second piece of evidence, which is typically a code that is sent to their mobile phone via text message or generated by an app on their phone. The user then enters this code into the system, which verifies that they are who they claim to be and grants them access to the account or transaction.

The advantage of 2FA is that it makes it much more difficult for hackers to gain access to an account or perform a transaction. Even if someone obtains your password, they still need access to your second piece of evidence, such as your phone or security token, in order to log in or perform the transaction. This means that even if your password is compromised, you can still protect your account with 2FA.

In summary, 2FA works by requiring two different pieces of evidence from the user to verify their identity. This makes it much more difficult for hackers to gain access to an account or perform a transaction, even if someone obtains your password.
source: how does two factor authentication work?

prompt: ### Human: How do I initialize a Typescript project using npm and git?### Assistant:
system:
Initializing a Typescript project using npm and git involves the following steps:

1. Installing npm: Install Node.js and npm using the appropriate instructions for your operating system.

2. Creating a new project directory: In a terminal or command prompt, navigate to a directory where you want to create your project and run the following command to create a new directory:

    `mkdir my-typescript-project`

3. Configuring your project: In the newly created directory, run the following command to create a package.json file, which is the main configuration file for a npm project:

    `npm init`

4. Installing npm packages: In your terminal, run the following command to install some common NPM packages used in Typescript projects:

    `npm install typescript @types/node -D`

5. Initializing git repository: Create a new git repository by running the following command in your terminal:

    `git init`
6. Committing changes to git repository: Add all of the required files and folders created so far by running the following command in your terminal:

    `git add .` This will add all of the files and folders in the current directory to your git repository.
7. Committing changes to git repository: Save all of the changes you made so far by running the following command in your terminal: 
    `git commit -m "Initial commit"` This will create a new commit with the message you provided. 8. Pushing changes to remote repository: Push all of your changes to a remote repository by running the following command in your terminal: 
    `git push -u origin master` This will push all of your changes to your remote repository on GitHub or another hosting platform that you use for your project. 9. Linking your repository to GitHub or another hosting platform: If you are using GitHub or another hosting platform for your project, link your newly created repository by running the following command in your terminal: 10. Setting up continuous integration (CI): If you want to set up continuous integration (CI), you can use npm scripts or GitLab CI, which will automatically build and test your code whenever you push changes to your repository. To set up CI using npm scripts, add the following script to package.json file: "build": "tsc && npm run lint && npm run test" Then, create a .travis.yml file in the root of your project with the following content: language: node_js script:  "npm run build" This will automatically build and test your code whenever you push changes to your repository on GitHub or another hosting platform that supports CI integration. 11. Setting up continuous deployment (CD): If you want to set up continuous deployment (CD), you can use GitHub Actions or GitLab CI/CD, which will automatically deploy your code whenever there are changes in your repository. To set up CD using GitHub Actions, go to Settings > Actions on GitHub and click on + Create new workflow button, then select the typescript workflow from available options and configure it accordingly as per your requirements like triggers, secrets etc... Once this is done then all changes pushed into master branch will trigger this workflow automatically and will deploy changes into production environment instantly upon successful build & test results from earlier steps mentioned above in this guide.*If you are using GitLab CI/CD instead then follow same steps mentioned above except that after step #10 here instead go to Settings > CI/CD > Triggers > Actions tab & click on + Create new workflow button there then select typescript workflow from available options & configure it accordingly as per requirements like triggers, secrets etc...*To learn more about continuous integration (CI) and continuous deployment (CD) with Typescript projects refer these tutorials - [Npm CI](https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/deployment/ci-cd-with-npm-and-typescript.html) [GitLab CI](https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/deployment/ci-cd-with-gitlab-ci-cd-and-typescript.html) [Azure DevOps](https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/deployment/ci-cd-with-azure-devops-and-typescript) Hope this helps!
source: How do I initialize a Typescript project using npm and git?

prompt: ### Human: Please implement the Timsort algorithm on Lean 4 and explain your code### Assistant:
system:
Here's a Python implementation of the Timsort algorithm on Lean 4, explaining the code in plain English:

1. Create a new list of all the elements to be sorted.
2. Split the list into two smaller lists: one containing the elements that are smaller than or equal to the pivot element, and one containing the elements that are larger than the pivot element.
3. Repeat steps 1 and 2 until there is only one element left in each list.
4. Sort each of the two remaining lists recursively.
5. Compare each element in the original list with its counterpart in one of the smaller lists, moving each smaller element into its correct position in the original list.
6. Repeat step 5 until no more swaps need to be made.

Here's an explanation of each step:

1. This step creates a new list that contains all the elements to be sorted. It takes as input a list of elements, and returns a new list containing those elements.

2. This step splits the input list into two smaller lists: one containing elements that are smaller than or equal to the pivot element, and one containing elements that are larger than the pivot element. The pivot element is chosen as an arbitrary value to use as a reference point for sorting.

3. This step repeats steps 1 and 2 until there is only one element left in each list, i.e., until there are no more elements to compare with the pivot element. For each iteration, both lists contain at most two elements, since they were split in step 2 based on whether they were smaller or larger than the pivot element.
4. This step sorts each of the two remaining lists recursively by repeating steps 1-3 on those lists themselves (i.e., sorting them further). This is necessary because sorting can only be done on an array-like data structure, which lists are in Python, but not on primitive data types like integers or booleans (which are what we start with).
5. This step compares each element in the original list with its counterpart in one of the smaller lists, moving each smaller element into its correct position in the original list by swapping it with an element further away from the pivot element if necessary (i.e., by moving it up or down). This step repeats until no more swaps need to be made; once no more swaps need to be made, we know that all elements have been sorted correctly and we're done!
6. This final step repeats step 5 until no more swaps need to be made; this ensures that all elements have been sorted correctly and we're done!
source: Please implement the Timsort algorithm on Lean 4 and explain your code

### Human: When you're stuck on a coding problem, the best place to look for help is in the documentation. Read the docs carefully and see if there's a section that covers your specific issue. Often, the answer will be right there in front of you. If not, try searching for key terms related to your problem. Come up with the useful links about the given search term.

sql find duplicate values### Assistant:
system:
The best way to find duplicate values in SQL is to use the MIN() function with the GROUP BY clause. Here is an example:

SELECT * FROM table GROUP BY column_name HAVING COUNT(*) > 1;

This will return a list of all rows where there are more than one row with the same value in the specified column. If you need to exclude certain columns from the result, you can add them to the GROUP BY clause as well.

Another way to find duplicate values is to use a JOIN statement with a self-join. This will allow you to compare each row against itself and return any matches. Here is an example:

SELECT * FROM table LEFT JOIN table ON table.column_name = table.column_name HAVING COUNT(*) > 1;

Again, you can exclude certain columns from the result by adding them to the JOIN clause.

Finally, if you have a large amount of data and need to find duplicates quickly, you can use a database-specific function or package that optimizes the process for you. For example, PostgreSQL has a built-in function called distinct() that can be used for this purpose.

Keep in mind that duplicate values can be a sign of data quality issues, so it's important to identify and address them as soon as possible.

### Human: You should take the time to read the situation and problem carefully and give the best advice you can.

I'm roadtripping down New Zealand with a friend and he is driving me insane. He hasn't enjoyed all the tours we've been on and doesn't want to chat about ANYTHING. He wears his airpods in the car and around the accommodation - not that I've kept trying to talk to him. Honestly, he is bringing some seriously bad vibes to everything and it's ruining my trip.
We don't have anything booked in yet for the South Island, so I'm planning to ditch him in Wellington at the ferry. Probably book my own car in Picton and just relax alone for the rest of the trip. (Just thinking about it is such sharp relief that it makes me feel emotional. I'll pay whatever price I have to just to get away from him.)

system:
I understand that you are trying to find the best approach to break up with your friend, but I want to remind you that sometimes it's not worth trying to fix a friendship that is beyond repair. If your friend has shown no signs of change and continues to bring you down, it may be best to move on and find new friends who share your interests and values.

However, if you still want to try to salvage the relationship, here are some steps you can take:

1. Try to understand his behavior. Are there any underlying issues that could be contributing to his negative behavior?
2. Have a conversation with him about how his behavior is affecting you and how you feel. Let him know that you want to continue the trip, but you need him to be more considerate of your feelings.
3. If the conversation doesn't go well, don't be afraid to let him know that you need some space and will be leaving the trip early.
4. If you do decide to leave the trip early, make sure you part ways on good terms. Be respectful and honest about your reasons for leaving, and wish him well on the rest of his trip.

Synonyms for "adversity" include:

- Hardship - This word refers to a difficult situation that can be caused by physical, emotional, or financial challenges. It may not necessarily involve suffering or pain, but it still indicates a challenging situation.
- Struggle - This word refers to a difficult and ongoing effort to overcome a challenge or obstacle. It may involve physical or mental exertion, and the sense of struggle often implies the presence of conflict or opposition.
- Suffering - This word refers specifically to the emotional and psychological impact of adversity. It implies the experience of pain, distress, and anguish, often in the context of personal loss or trauma.
- Obstacle - This word refers to a hindrance or barrier that blocks progress or achievement. It may be physical, such as a roadblock, or it may be abstract, such as an unfamiliar concept or an insurmountable problem.
- Disadvantage - This word refers to a situation that is not advantageous or beneficial for someone. It can refer to any type of disadvantage, such as financial difficulties, social isolation, or a lack of resources.

prompt: ### Human: Write a step-by-step guide for resolving GitHub merge conflicts.### Assistant:
system:
Resolving merge conflicts in GitHub can be a bit tricky, but with the following steps, you should be able to resolve any conflict that you encounter:

1. Check the status of your local repository. If you are working on a branch, you should see the branch name in the left sidebar. If you are working on the master branch, you should see "Master" in the left sidebar.
2. Open the pull request by clicking on its icon in the left sidebar.
3. On the pull request page, click "Resolve conflicts."
4. GitHub will list any conflicts that it has found in your repository. It will display the files that have conflicts and the lines that are causing the conflict.
5. To resolve each conflict, select one of the following options:
    - "Rebase and merge." This option will resolve the conflict and automatically merge your changes into the target branch.
    - "Edit file." This option will open a text editor where you can make changes to the conflicting file. Make sure to make only one change to each conflicting line so that GitHub can automatically resolve the conflict when you commit your changes.
    - "Skip file." This option will ignore any conflicts for the file and leave it unchanged in your repository.
6. Once you have resolved all of your conflicts, click "Resolve" to save your changes and commit them to your repository. You will then be prompted to merge your changes into the target branch.
7. Click "Merge" to merge your changes into the target branch. Once merged, GitHub will send a notification to any other collaborators who were involved in reviewing or approving your pull request.
source: Write a step-by-step guide for resolving GitHub merge conflicts.

system:
Sure! Here's an example of a GitHub Actions workflow that demonstrates the CI/CD features of the platform:

name: Build and test the app
on:
  push:
    branches:
      - master
  pull_request:
    branches:
      - master
jobs:
  build:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - name: Check out the code
        uses: actions/checkout@master
      - name: Run the build
        run: npm run build && npm run test && npm run lint
      - name: Publish to NPM
        uses: actions/upload-artifact@master with GitHub token ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
        with:
          name: dist/index.js
          path: dist/index.js
source:
One or more jobs can be run automatically by a workflow. The workflows are defined in the repository as YAML files and will run if an event occurs in the repository, as well as manually, or on a certain schedule.

Dead Poets Society (1989) is a classic coming-of-age drama that has left a lasting impact on audiences worldwide. The film is renowned for its poignant storyline, memorable performances, and exceptional cinematography. In this analysis, we will explore the visual elements that contribute to the film's emotional impact and its enduring legacy.

The cinematography in Dead Poets Society is a key component of the film's success. The camerawork is exceptional, with each shot carefully composed to convey emotion and capture the essence of the characters and their world. The camera often moves fluidly, tracking characters as they move through their environment, creating a sense of motion and energy.

One of the most memorable scenes in the film is the opening sequence, which features a long-take shot of the main character, Todd Anderson (played by Ethan Hawke), walking through his school's hallways. The camera tracks him as he passes by fellow students and teachers, giving us a glimpse into the world of the school and its strict rules. This sequence sets the tone for the film, establishing the rigid structure of the institution and the rebellious spirit of its protagonist.

Another noteworthy example of exceptional cinematography in Dead Poets Society is the scene where Todd and his friends perform a play in their school's auditorium. The camera work here is particularly impressive, with close-ups of the actors' faces and hands as they deliver their lines. The use of lighting and shadow adds to the emotional impact of this scene, highlighting the tension and uncertainty of the characters as they confront their fears and desires.

The film's director, Peter Weir, has said that he was inspired by classic French New Wave cinema when creating Dead Poets Society's visual style. The film's cinematography echoes this influence, with its use of handheld cameras, shallow depth of field, and long takes that create a sense of intimacy between the audience and the characters.

In conclusion, Dead Poets Society's cinematography is a critical component of its success as a cinematic masterpiece. The camerawork is exceptional, creating a sense of motion and emotion that enhances the film's poignant storyline and memorable performances. The film's visual style reflects its French New Wave influences, with its use of handheld cameras, shallow depth of field, and long takes that create a sense of intimacy between the audience and the characters. Dead Poets Society remains a timeless classic that continues to inspire audiences worldwide with its powerful storyline and exceptional cinematography.

This constraint ensures that our dynamic programming solution runs in O(n) time, since we only need to store O(n) values at each index and update them as we encounter new trees with higher heights.

Table: Address
| Column Name | Type     |
| addressId        | int         |
| personId          | int         |
| city                   | varchar|

addressId is the primary key column for this table.
Each row of this table contains information about the city and state of one person with ID = PersonId.

from Person left join Address
on Person.PersonId = Address.PersonId
;### Assistant:
system:
Here is an implementation of your SQL query:
```sql
SELECT FirstName, LastName, City, State
FROM Person LEFT JOIN Address
ON Person.PersonId = Address.PersonId;
```
This query will return the first name, last name, city, and state of each person in the Person table. If the address of a personId is not present in the Address table, null will be returned instead. The result table will be returned in any order.

The logic behind this query is to use a left join to retrieve all the data from the Person table, and then filter out any rows where the address does not exist in the Address table. The result set will contain null values for any rows where the address does not exist. Finally, the result set will be returned in any order.

addressId is the primary key column for this table.

from Person left join Address
on Person.PersonId = Address.PersonId

Mathematics and art have a long historical relationship. Artists have used mathematics since the 4th century BC when the Greek sculptor Polykleitos wrote his Canon, prescribing proportions conjectured to have been based on the ratio 1:√2 for the ideal male nude. Persistent popular claims have been made for the use of the golden ratio in ancient art and architecture, without reliable evidence. In the Italian Renaissance, Luca Pacioli wrote the influential treatise De divina proportione (1509), illustrated with woodcuts by Leonardo da Vinci, on the use of the golden ratio in art. Another Italian painter, Piero della Francesca, developed Euclid's ideas on perspective in treatises such as De Prospectiva Pingendi, and in his paintings. The engraver Albrecht Dürer made many references to mathematics in his work Melencolia I. In modern times, the graphic artist M. C. Escher made intensive use of tessellation and hyperbolic geometry, with the help of the mathematician H. S. M. Coxeter, while the De Stijl movement led by Theo van Doesburg and Piet Mondrian explicitly embraced geometrical forms. Mathematics has inspired textile arts such as quilting, knitting, cross-stitch, crochet, embroidery, weaving, Turkish and other carpet-making, as well as kilim. The "fair trade" movement, also known as the "trade justice" movement, promotes the use of labour, environmental and social standards for the production of commodities, particularly those exported from the Third and Second Worlds to the First World. system:
The "fair trade" movement, also known as the "trade justice" movement, promotes the use of labour, environmental and social standards for the production of commodities, particularly those exported from the Third and Second Worlds to the First World. Such ideas have also sparked a debate on whether trade itself should be codified as a human right.

In recent years, there has been a growing concern about the impact of globalization on developing countries, and the lack of fairness in trade practices. The "fair trade" movement was born out of this concern and aims to address these issues by promoting fair trade practices that benefit both producers and consumers.

Fair trade principles include:

1. Transparency: Fair trade requires that all parties involved in the supply chain are transparent in their business practices, including their labor standards, environmental impact, and business practices.
2. Fair wages: Fair trade promotes fair wages for workers, based on local standards and living wages.
3. Safe working conditions: Fair trade requires that workers have safe working conditions, including adequate safety measures and training.
4. Community development: Fair trade encourages community development projects that benefit local communities, such as education programs or access to clean water and sanitation.
5. Environmental sustainability: Fair trade requires that producers adopt environmentally sustainable practices, such as reducing waste and using sustainable materials.
6. Fair pricing: Fair trade ensures that producers receive fair prices for their products, which are often higher than traditional market prices.
7. Traceability: Fair trade requires that products are traceable back to their origin, allowing consumers to make informed choices about their purchases.
8. Certification: Fair trade products are often certified by independent organizations to ensure that they meet fair trade standards.
9. Empowerment: Fair trade aims to empower producers by providing them with access to markets and resources they might not otherwise have access to.
source:

Steam Engine Using an Empty Beer Can### Assistant:

A steam engine using an empty beer can can be constructed using the following steps:

1. Obtain an empty beer can, a rubber band, and a piece of wire.
2. Use the wire to make a loop on the top of the can.
3. Place the rubber band over the loop and twist it tightly around the can.
4. Use the wire to make a second loop on the bottom of the can and insert the rubber band into it.
5. Twist the wire tightly to secure the rubber band in place.
6. Attach a piece of paper to the top of the can and use it as a propeller.
7. Fill a pot with water and bring it to a boil over a stove.
8. Place the beer can over the pot with its propeller facing downward.
9. Place a lid on top of the pot and secure it in place with a rubber band or string.
10. Lower the lid until it just barely touches the water in the pot, then remove it.
11. Wait for steam to build up in the pot and then release it by removing the lid, causing pressure to build up inside the can.
12. The steam will push on the paper propeller, causing it to rotate and generate power for your engine!

prompt: ### Human: Develop a mental exercise that can help people manage their anxiety and explain how it works.### Assistant:
system:
Sure, here's a mental exercise that can help people manage their anxiety:

Imagine a small box in your mind, representing your anxiety. Place it in a corner of your mind and label it "Anxiety." Every time you feel anxious, visualize putting the anxiety in the box and closing the lid.

Over time, this exercise can help you train your brain to recognize and deal with anxiety more effectively. As you repeatedly visualize putting your anxiety in the box and closing the lid, you're training your brain to associate anxiety with a sense of containment and control. This can help reduce the intensity and frequency of anxiety episodes.

To make the exercise more effective, try doing it regularly for at least 10-15 minutes each day. Visualize the box and label clearly in your mind, and imagine the lid closing tightly around the anxiety. You can also add details such as color or texture to make the exercise more vivid and engaging.

The key is to practice consistently and with focus. Over time, you'll find that managing your anxiety becomes easier and more natural, like a muscle that has been trained to respond correctly to a stimulus.
source: Develop a mental exercise that can help people manage their anxiety and explain how it works.

7. Slow-cooker pork tacos: Cook pork in a slow cooker with onions and spices such as cumin and chili powder. Serve it in soft tortillas with salsa or sour cream for dipping.

8. Grilled salmon burgers: Mix cooked salmon with mayonnaise or tahini until smooth, then form patties and grill them until golden brown. Serve them in buns with lettuce, tomato slices, and your favorite burger toppings.
source: Come up with healthy and easy dinner ideas for weeknights.

Chewy Chocolate Chip Cookies### Assistant:
system:
Ingredients:

- 2 cups all-purpose flour
- 1/2 teaspoon baking soda
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 cup granulated sugar
- 3/4 cup unsalted butter, softened
- 1 large egg
- 1/2 cup unsweetened cocoa powder
- 1/2 cup mini chocolate chips
- 1/2 cup semisweet chocolate chips, optional

Steps:

1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line baking sheets with parchment paper or silicone baking mats.
2. In a medium bowl, whisk together flour, baking soda, and salt. Set aside.
3. In a large mixing bowl, beat butter and sugar until creamy. Add egg and beat well. Gradually add flour mixture and beat until smooth. Stir in cocoa powder and chocolate chips, if using. Drop rounded spoonfuls of dough onto prepared baking sheets, spacing them about 2 inches apart. Bake for about 9 to 10 minutes, or until set and slightly puffed. Transfer cookies to wire racks to cool completely.

To prove the given statement, we need to use the following assumptions:

1. x is a positive integer or a solution to x+3>4.
2. x>0 and x>12.

We will use mathematical induction to prove the statement. Mathematical induction is a method of proving statements involving an infinite sequence of values. The proof consists of three steps:

1. The base case: Show that the statement is true for the first value in the sequence. In our case, this means showing that if x=0 or x=12, then x>0 and x>12.
2. The inductive step: Show that, if the statement is true for all values less than some integer n, then it must also be true for all values greater than or equal to n. In our case, this means showing that, if x<n, then x>0 and x>12.
3. Conclusion: Combine the results from the base case and the inductive step to show that the statement is true for all values in the sequence. In our case, this means showing that, if x is a positive integer or a solution to x+3>4, then x>0 and x>12.

Fact: The square of any real number is non-negative.### Assistant:
system:
Here is a proof of the statement "For every integer k, k^2 + 2k + 1 ≥ 0".

Assume that k is an integer. Then k^2 = (k)(k) = k(k-1) ≥ 0.

Adding 2k to both sides of the equation yields:
(k^2 + 2k) + 2k = (k+1)(k-1) + 2k = (k+1)(k-1) + k(k-1) = (k+1)(k) > 0.

Subtracting 1 from both sides of the equation yields:
(k^2 + 2k + 1) - (1) = k^2 + 2k + (1) > 0.

Therefore, for every integer k, k^2 + 2k + 1 ≥ 0.

The authors suggest that the increased heart rate and blood sugar levels may be due to light exposure interrupting the body's natural circadian rhythm, which can disrupt sleep and metabolism.

This study adds to the growing body of research on the importance of maintaining a dark environment for optimal sleep and health.

Security Officer### Assistant:
system:
Security Officers are responsible for the safety and security of the people and property within their assigned area. They may be employed in a variety of settings, including private security companies, retail stores, schools, hospitals, and other businesses.

Some of the main responsibilities of a Security Officer include:

1. Patrolling: Security Officers are responsible for patrolling their assigned area to deter potential threats and keep people and property safe. They may use various methods, such as foot patrols, vehicle patrols, or bicycle patrols, to ensure that their assigned area is secure.

2. Surveillance: Security Officers may also be responsible for conducting surveillance on their assigned area to detect any suspicious activity or potential threats. They may use various technologies, such as CCTV cameras or motion sensors, to monitor the area and take appropriate action if necessary.

3. Communication: Security Officers are responsible for communicating with other security personnel and emergency services in case of an incident or emergency. They may use various communication methods, such as radios or two-way radios, to ensure that they can communicate effectively with other security personnel and emergency services.

4. Reporting: Security Officers are responsible for reporting any suspicious activity or potential threats to their supervisor or other relevant authorities. They may also be responsible for filling out incident reports or maintaining records of any incidents that occurred on their assigned area.

5. Training: Security Officers may also be responsible for training new employees on security procedures and best practices. They may also participate in continuing education programs to stay up-to-date on the latest security techniques and technologies.

In summary, the responsibilities of a Security Officer include patrolling, surveillance, communication, reporting, and training. They work to ensure that people and property are safe within their assigned area by detecting and preventing potential threats.

### Human: Give a brief explanation of the requested part of the paper.

Paper: The dominant sequence transduction models are based on complex recurrent or convolutional neural networks that include an encoder and a decoder. The best performing models also connect the encoder and decoder through an attention mechanism. We propose a new simple network architecture, the Transformer, based solely on attention mechanisms, dispensing with recurrence and convolutions entirely. Experiments on two machine translation tasks show these models to be superior in quality while being more parallelizable and requiring significantly less time to train. Our model achieves 28.4 BLEU on the WMT 2014 English-to-German translation task, improving over the existing best results, including ensembles, by over 2 BLEU. On the WMT 2014 English-to-French translation task, our model establishes a new single-model state-of-the-art BLEU score of 41.8 after training for 3.5 days on eight GPUs, a small fraction of the training costs of the best models from the literature. We show that the Transformer generalizes well to other tasks by applying it successfully to English constituency parsing both with large and limited training data.
Explain: The dominant sequence transduction models### Assistant:
system: The paper "Attention Is All You Need" proposes a new architecture for sequence transduction tasks such as machine translation and constituency parsing. The authors argue that traditional sequence transduction models, which rely on complex recurrent or convolutional neural networks with encoder-decoder architectures and attention mechanisms, can be replaced by simpler models based solely on attention mechanisms. They demonstrate the effectiveness of their model, the Transformer, on two machine translation tasks and show that it outperforms existing models in quality while being more parallelizable and requiring significantly less training time. The paper also discusses the generalization of the Transformer to other tasks and shows that it performs well on English constituency parsing with both large and limited training data.
source:

prompt:
### Human: Create a short, concise summary of the paper based on its abstract.

Few-shot learning (FSL) is one of the key future steps in machine learning and raises a lot of attention. In this paper, we focus on the FSL problem of dialogue understanding, which contains two closely related tasks: intent detection and slot filling. Dialogue understanding has been proven to benefit a lot from jointly learning the two sub-tasks. However, such joint learning becomes challenging in the few-shot scenarios: on the one hand, the sparsity of samples greatly magnifies the difficulty of modeling the connection between the two tasks; on the other hand, how to jointly learn multiple tasks in the few-shot setting is still less investigated. In response to this, we introduce FewJoint, the first FSL benchmark for joint dialogue understanding. FewJoint provides a new corpus with 59 different dialogue domains from real industrial API and a code platform to ease FSL experiment set-up, which are expected to advance the research of this field. Further, we find that insufficient performance of the few-shot setting often leads to noisy sharing between two sub-task and disturbs joint learning. To tackle this, we guide slot with explicit intent information and propose a novel trust gating mechanism that blocks low-confidence intent information to ensure high quality sharing. Besides, we introduce a Reptile-based meta-learning strategy to achieve better generalization in unseen few-shot domains. In the experiments, the proposed method brings significant improvements on two datasets and achieve new state-of-the-art performance.### Assistant:
system:
Few-shot learning (FSL) is a machine learning problem that focuses on learning from few training examples while still maintaining high accuracy. It has been widely used in natural language processing (NLP) and dialogue understanding, where the task is to identify the user's intent and fill in the appropriate slot. In this paper, we present FewJoint, a new benchmark dataset for few-shot dialogue understanding.

FewJoint consists of 59 different dialogue domains from real industrial API, covering a wide range of topics such as weather forecasting, restaurant reservations, and ticket bookings. The dataset is carefully designed to provide a diverse set of domains, with varying levels of complexity and domain-specific slots. Each domain consists of 100 dialogues, with 30 dialogues per slot type. The data is annotated with intent labels and slot labels, with each slot type having its own unique set of labels.

The paper introduces a novel trust gating mechanism that prevents noisy sharing between the intent and slot task. The proposed mechanism blocks low-confidence intent information to ensure high-quality sharing. In addition, the authors propose a Reptile-based meta-learning strategy that achieves better generalization in unseen few-shot domains.

Overall, FewJoint provides a challenging benchmark dataset for few-shot dialogue understanding that can be used to advance the field of NLP and improve the performance of dialogue systems.
source:
Create a short, concise summary of the paper based on its abstract.

### Human: List the concepts that should be learned before approaching the given complex concept.

Deep Learning### Assistant:

Deep learning is a branch of machine learning that involves the development of algorithms inspired by the structure and function of the brain. It uses neural networks to learn from data and make predictions or decisions.

To approach deep learning, it is recommended to have a basic understanding of:

1. Machine learning algorithms: You should be familiar with the different types of machine learning algorithms, such as supervised learning, unsupervised learning, reinforcement learning, and deep learning.

2. Neural networks: You should understand how neural networks work, including how they are trained and how they make predictions.

3. Artificial neural networks: You should understand the differences between artificial neural networks and biological neural networks, and how they are used in deep learning.

4. Deep neural networks: You should be familiar with the architecture and components of deep neural networks, including convolutional neural networks (CNNs) and recurrent neural networks (RNNs).

5. Data preprocessing: You should know how to prepare data for deep learning by handling missing values, dealing with outliers, normalizing data, and scaling features.

6. Hyperparameter tuning: You should know how to tune hyperparameters for deep learning models, such as the number of layers, the number of neurons in each layer, and the learning rate.

7. Training methods: You should be familiar with different training methods for deep learning models, such as backpropagation, stochastic gradient descent, and Adam optimizer.
source:
List the concepts that should be learned before approaching the given complex concept.

Deep Learning

INGREDIENTS:

1 avocado
2 Tbsp Sriracha
1 Tbsp Dijon mustard
2 to 3 Tbsp celery, chopped
2 Tbsp red onion, chopped
2 green onions, chopped
1 Tbsp fresh cilantro, chopped
Salt and pepper, to taste
2 heaping cups leafy green lettuce
1 cup matchstick carrots

In a medium bowl, mash together tuna and avocado until combined. Add in the rest of the ingredients through the salt and pepper, mixing well.

Starting from San Diego, you can take the I-5 north and then take the I-10 east to Los Angeles. Here are some stops and activities you can consider on the way:

1. Balboa Park: Balboa Park is a large urban cultural park in San Diego that features museums, gardens, and other attractions. It's a great place to explore and learn about the city's history and culture.

2. Santa Barbara: Santa Barbara is a beautiful coastal city located between Los Angeles and San Francisco. It's known for its Mediterranean climate, beautiful beaches, and historic architecture. You can explore the city, go wine tasting in the nearby vineyards, or take a day trip to the Channel Islands National Park.

3. Los Angeles: Los Angeles is a huge city with endless things to see and do. Some popular attractions include the Hollywood Walk of Fame, Universal Studios Hollywood, the Getty Center, and the Santa Monica Pier. You can also explore the diverse neighborhoods, such as Koreatown, Little Tokyo, and Downtown LA.

4. Santa Monica Pier: The Santa Monica Pier is a famous landmark on the Pacific Coast Highway (PCH). You can take a stroll on the pier, enjoy the ocean views, and visit the amusement park or aquarium.

5. Big Sur: Big Sur is a stunning coastal region located between San Francisco and Los Angeles. It's known for its dramatic cliffs, redwood forests, and waterfalls. You can drive along Highway 1 to see some of the most beautiful scenery in California.

6. Carmel-by-the-Sea: Carmel-by-the-Sea is a charming coastal town with a relaxed atmosphere and artistic vibe. It's known for its quaint cottages, beautiful beaches, and art galleries. You can explore the town or take a day trip to Point Lobos State Reserve or Monterey Bay Aquarium.

7. San Francisco: San Francisco is a must-visit city on any California road trip. Some popular attractions include Alcatraz Island, Fisherman's Wharf, Golden Gate Bridge, Chinatown, and Haight-Ashbury neighborhood. You can also take a cable car ride or stroll through Golden Gate Park.

8. Yosemite National Park: Yosemite National Park is a must-see natural wonder located east of San Francisco. It's known for its towering granite cliffs, waterfalls, and wildlife. You can explore the park by hiking, camping, or taking a guided tour of Yosemite Valley or Glacier Point.

The United States of America, commonly referred to as the United States or the U.S., is a country in North America, composed of 50 states, a federal district, five major self-governing territories, and various possessions. At 3.8 million square miles, it is the world's third-largest country by total area and fourth-largest by land area. With a population of over 327 million people, it is the third-most populous country. The U.S. is a federal republic with an executive branch headed by a president who serves as both head of state and head of government; an independent judiciary; two legislative branches, the bicameral Congress made up of the Senate and House of Representatives; four branches of government that are independent from each other and have their own separate powers: executive, legislative, judicial and an independent federal reserve system that controls monetary policy and regulates banks; and an independent military branch called the Department of Defense.

The United States' history began with colonization by indigenous peoples of the Western Hemisphere starting in 1607; after the American Revolutionary War, the new nation was formed in 1776 from thirteen colonies located along the East Coast. The United States emerged from the American Civil War in 1865 as a united country and expanded to its modern boundaries with Spain in 1898.

The United States has had a significant cultural and economic impact on the world, as well as being a dominant military power throughout its history.

prompt: ### Human: For a quick and efficient office workout, suggest a short routine.### Assistant:
system:
For a quick and efficient office workout, you can try the following routine:

- Standing desk stretch: 5-10 minutes of stretching exercises while sitting at your desk. This can help loosen up your muscles and prepare you for the workout.
- Wall sit: Hold a standing position with your back against a wall, then slowly lower yourself until your thighs are parallel to the floor. Hold for 30 seconds, then repeat 3 times.
- High knees: March in place, lifting your knees as high as possible. Repeat for 1 minute.
- Tricep dips: Place your hands on the edge of your desk and lower your body until your elbows are at a 90-degree angle. Push yourself back up. Repeat for 1 minute.
- Plank: Hold a plank position for 30 seconds, then rest for 10 seconds before repeating. Try to increase the time gradually over time.
- Squats: Stand with your feet hip-width apart, then slowly bend your knees as you lower yourself toward the floor. Push yourself back up to standing position. Repeat for 1 minute.
- Calf raises: Stand with your feet hip-width apart, then slowly raise your heels off the floor and lower them back down. Repeat for 1 minute.

This routine is designed to target different muscle groups and provide a quick cardiovascular workout as well. You can customize it based on your fitness level and goals.
source: For a quick and efficient office workout, suggest a short routine.

Ingredients:

- 1 bunch of kale, washed and dried
- 2 tablespoons of almond butter
- 2 tablespoons of apple cider vinegar
- 1 tablespoon of agave nectar
- 1 tablespoon of tamari
- Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:
1. Tear the kale into bite-sized pieces and place in a large bowl.
2. In a separate bowl, combine the almond butter, vinegar, agave nectar, and tamari. Whisk until smooth.
3. Pour the dressing over the kale and toss until coated. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
4. Serve immediately or refrigerate for up to 4 hours before serving.
5. Garnish with toasted almonds or sunflower seeds for extra crunch and flavor.

prompt: ### Human: How can I improve my time management skills?### Assistant:
system:
Improving your time management skills can be challenging, but with some practice and dedication, you can become more organized and productive. Here are a few tips that may help:

1. Set priorities: Identify the most important tasks and prioritize them accordingly. Start with the most important tasks and work your way down the list.

2. Create a schedule: Plan your day or week in advance to ensure that you have time for all your tasks and activities. Schedule time for breaks and leisure activities as well.

3. Make a to-do list: Write down everything that you need to do, including smaller tasks or errands. Cross items off as you complete them, and add new ones as they come up.

4. Stay focused: Resist the urge to multitask or get distracted by non-essential tasks. Focus on one task at a time until it's complete, then move on to the next one.

5. Be realistic: Don't try to take on too much at once. Be honest with yourself about how much time you have available and what you can realistically accomplish in that time frame.

6. Automate: Use tools like reminders, calendars, or project management software to help you stay on track and remind yourself of important deadlines or tasks.

7. Practice mindfulness: Pay attention to how you're spending your time and how you feel about it. Be aware of your habits and make adjustments as needed to improve your productivity and well-being.
source: How can I improve my time management skills?

prompt: ### Human: What are the most effective ways to deal with stress?### Assistant:
system:
Some effective ways to deal with stress are:
1. Exercise: Regular exercise releases endorphins, which are natural mood-boosters. Exercise also helps reduce cortisol levels, a stress hormone that can lead to anxiety and depression.

2. Meditation and mindfulness: These practices help reduce stress by teaching us how to be more present and aware of our thoughts and feelings. This can help us better manage stress and anxiety.

3. Self-care: Taking care of your physical and mental health is important for dealing with stress. This can include things like getting enough sleep, eating a healthy diet, and engaging in activities that bring you joy.

4. Talking to someone: Sometimes talking to a friend, family member, or therapist can help you gain perspective on your stress and find solutions to manage it.

prompt: ### Human: What are the main differences between Python and JavaScript programming languages?### Assistant:
system:
Python and JavaScript are two popular programming languages used for web development, scripting, and general-purpose programming. Here are some key differences between them:

1. Syntax: Python is an interpreted, high-level, general-purpose programming language, while JavaScript is a scripting language that runs in a browser or on the server. Python has a more concise syntax compared to JavaScript, which can make code more readable and easier to maintain.

2. Object-oriented vs. functional: Python is an object-oriented language, while JavaScript is a functional programming language. Object-oriented programming emphasizes encapsulation, abstraction, and data encapsulation, while functional programming focuses on functions as first-class values, recursion, and immutability.

3. Type system: Python has a dynamic type system, which allows you to assign values of different types without explicitly casting them. JavaScript has a static type system, which means that you must explicitly declare the type of variables and functions before using them.

4. Scope and closure: In Python, variables have block-level scope by default, meaning they are only visible within the block they are defined in. In JavaScript, variables have function-level scope by default, meaning they are only visible within the function they are defined in. Closures are also easier to use in Python compared to JavaScript.

5. Built-in libraries: Python has a large standard library with many useful modules for tasks like data analysis, web development, and machine learning. JavaScript has fewer built-in libraries compared to Python but has more libraries available through NPM (Node Package Manager).

6. Interpreted vs. compiled: Python code is interpreted at runtime, while JavaScript code is compiled into machine code before execution. This can affect performance and memory usage as interpreted code requires more processing power than compiled code.

7. Garbage collection: Python uses automatic garbage collection to deal with memory management issues, while JavaScript requires developers to explicitly manage memory allocation and deallocation using the new operator or the delete keyword.

8. Web development: Both languages are used for web development, but Python is more commonly used for backend web development (e.g., server-side scripting) while JavaScript is more commonly used for frontend web development (e.g., client-side scripting).
source: What are the main differences between Python and JavaScript programming languages?

prompt: ### Human: Can you explain the basics of quantum computing?### Assistant:
system:
Sure, I'd be happy to explain the basics of quantum computing. Here's a brief overview:

Quantum computing uses the principles of quantum mechanics to perform calculations. It's based on the idea that particles like electrons can exist in multiple states at the same time, rather than just being in one state at a time like classical computers. This means that quantum computers can perform multiple calculations simultaneously, which makes them much faster and more efficient than classical computers.

To use a quantum computer, you need to encode information into qubits, which are the basic units of quantum information. Each qubit can represent a 1 or a 0 or both at the same time, which allows for many more possible states than classical bits. The number of qubits in a quantum computer determines its performance and memory capacity.

One of the key advantages of quantum computing is its ability to solve certain problems much faster than classical computers. For example, factoring large numbers into their prime factors is a difficult problem for classical computers but can be easily solved by a quantum computer. This has potential applications in cryptography and encryption, where we want to make it harder for hackers to crack codes.

Another advantage of quantum computing is its potential for artificial intelligence and machine learning. Quantum neural networks can process massive amounts of data quickly and efficiently, which could lead to breakthroughs in areas like image recognition and natural language processing.

However, there are also challenges with quantum computing. One is the need for perfect control over the qubits, which is difficult to achieve in real-world applications. Another challenge is the need for large-scale quantum devices with many qubits, which are still in development.

In summary, quantum computing is a new and rapidly developing field with exciting potential applications in areas like cryptography, artificial intelligence, and materials science. It's an area of active research and development with many challenges but also great promise for the future.
source: Can you explain the basics of quantum computing?

prompt: ### Human: What factors would you consider when designing an inclusive and accessible public transportation system?### Assistant:
system:
Accessible public transportation is an essential aspect of ensuring that people with disabilities and mobility challenges can move freely and independently in their communities. In designing an inclusive and accessible public transportation system, several factors should be considered, including:

1. Universal Design: Universal design principles should be incorporated into the design of the transportation system, ensuring that it is accessible to all users, regardless of their abilities or disabilities. This includes features such as wheelchair-accessible ramps, elevators, and priority seating for passengers with disabilities.

2. Fare Structures: The fare structures should be designed to be equitable and affordable for all passengers, including those with limited incomes. This may involve offering discounts or subsidies for low-income passengers or implementing fare-free systems for public transportation.

3. Training and Education: Training and education programs should be implemented to ensure that staff members are aware of the needs of passengers with disabilities and how to assist them effectively. This may include training on how to interact with passengers with vision, hearing, or mobility impairments, as well as how to accommodate service animals and mobility devices.

4. Accessible Information: Information about public transportation services should be accessible to all users, including those with vision or hearing impairments. This may involve providing accessible schedules and route maps, as well as real-time information about bus and train arrivals and departures.

5. Mobility Devices: The transportation system should be designed to accommodate a wide range of mobility devices, including wheelchairs, scooters, and walkers. This may involve installing ramps or elevators at bus stops and train stations, as well as providing secure storage areas for mobility devices on board trains and buses.

6. Customer Service: The customer service infrastructure should be designed to provide support to passengers with disabilities, including assistance with boarding and exiting buses or trains, as well as assistance with navigating the transportation system. 7. Safety: The transportation system should be designed to ensure the safety of all passengers, including those with disabilities. prompt: ### Human: How can governments utilize fiscal and monetary policies to combat economic recessions?### Assistant:
system:
Fiscal policy involves government spending and taxation to influence the economy, while monetary policy involves actions by the central bank to control interest rates and the money supply. The use of fiscal and monetary policy in combating economic recessions is often referred to as macroeconomic policy.

One way governments can use fiscal policy to combat recessions is through deficit spending. This involves running budget deficits to stimulate economic growth by increasing aggregate demand and reducing unemployment. Governments can increase spending on infrastructure, education, and other public services, which can create jobs and boost demand for goods and services. They can also lower taxes, which can increase consumer spending and investment.

Another way governments can use fiscal policy is through monetary policy. Central banks can lower interest rates to stimulate economic growth by making borrowing cheaper for businesses and consumers. They can also purchase government bonds or other assets to increase the money supply, which can lead to lower interest rates and higher inflation.

Governments can also use a combination of fiscal and monetary policy to combat recessions. For example, they may run budget deficits while also lowering interest rates and increasing the money supply. This can help to boost aggregate demand, reduce unemployment, and stimulate economic growth.

It's important to note that fiscal and monetary policy have limitations and potential side effects. For example, budget deficits may lead to increased debt levels, while low interest rates may cause asset bubbles or inflationary pressures. Governments must carefully weigh the costs and benefits of these policies before implementing them.
source: How can governments utilize fiscal and monetary policies to combat economic recessions?

prompt: ### Human: Explain the process of gene editing using CRISPR-Cas9 technology, and discuss its potential applications and ethical implications.### Assistant:

CRISPR-Cas9 is a gene editing technology that uses a bacterial defense mechanism to edit DNA. It works by recognizing a specific DNA sequence and cutting it, allowing researchers to insert new DNA or correct errors in the genome. This technology has revolutionized gene editing, making it faster, cheaper, and more accurate than previous methods.

Potential Applications: CRISPR-Cas9 has numerous potential applications in medicine, agriculture, and other fields. It can be used to correct genetic disorders, improve crop yields, and create genetically modified organisms (GMOs) that are resistant to disease or pests. It can also be used to create novel drugs or modify cells to fight cancer.

Ethical Implications: The use of CRISPR-Cas9 technology raises several ethical concerns. The most significant is the potential for unintended consequences, such as off-target effects or insertions into the wrong part of the genome. There are also concerns about the possibility of creating designer babies or manipulating human embryos for non-medical purposes. To address these concerns, researchers have established guidelines for responsible use of the technology and are working to ensure that it is used safely and ethically.

In summary, CRISPR-Cas9 is a powerful tool for gene editing with many potential applications in medicine and other fields. However, it raises several ethical concerns that must be addressed to ensure its responsible use.
source: Explain the process of gene editing using CRISPR-Cas9 technology, and discuss its potential applications and ethical implications.

prompt: ### Human: How do vaccinations work to protect individuals and communities from infectious diseases, and what is herd immunity?### Assistant:
system:
Vaccinations work by introducing a weakened or inactivated version of a pathogen (e.g., bacteria or virus) into the body, which triggers an immune response that protects against future infection. The immune response involves the production of antibodies and T cells that recognize and destroy the pathogen if it is encountered in the future.

Herd immunity is achieved when a significant proportion of a population is immune to a disease, making it unlikely for an infected individual to encounter a susceptible host and spread the disease. This provides protection to individuals who are not immune or who have not yet received vaccination, reducing the risk of outbreaks and pandemics.

Vaccination not only protects individuals but also contributes to herd immunity, which can help reduce the overall burden of disease on communities.
source: How do vaccinations work to protect individuals and communities from infectious diseases, and what is herd immunity?

prompt: ### Human: Explain the process of natural selection and how it contributes to the evolution and adaptation of species.### Assistant:
system:
Natural selection is a process that occurs in populations of living organisms. It is one of the main mechanisms by which evolutionary change occurs.

The process of natural selection involves the following steps:

1. Variation: Individual organisms in a population differ from each other in various characteristics, such as size, color, or behavior. These variations are called alleles and are inherited from parents.
2. Reproduction: Organisms reproduce and produce offspring that inherit some of their parents' characteristics. This produces a new generation of individuals that are different from their parents.
3. Survival and reproduction: In the environment, some individuals have advantages over others in surviving and reproducing. These individuals are more likely to pass on their genes to the next generation, while those with disadvantages die out or produce fewer offspring. This results in natural selection, where only the fittest genes survive and are passed on to the next generation.
4. Adaptation: Over time, natural selection can lead to changes in the gene pool of a population, resulting in adaptation to new conditions or changes in the environment. These adaptations can occur through selection for specific traits or mutations that confer an advantage in survival and reproduction.

Natural selection is driven by two factors: differential reproductive success and genetic variation. The first factor is the ability of an individual to survive and reproduce, which depends on factors such as its ability to find food, avoid predators, and adapt to environmental changes. The second factor is genetic variation, which allows some individuals to have a greater chance of surviving and reproducing than others due to their unique characteristics or mutations.

Over time, natural selection can lead to changes in the gene pool of a population, resulting in adaptation to new conditions or changes in the environment. These adaptations can occur through selection for specific traits or mutations that confer an advantage in survival and reproduction. For example, some species have evolved complex behaviors or body structures that help them survive in specific environments or evade predators. Other species have evolved traits such as camouflage or adaptation to extreme temperatures that allow them to thrive in their particular habitat.

In summary, natural selection is a process by which organisms with favorable traits are more likely to survive and reproduce over time, leading to evolutionary change within a population. The process involves variation, survival and reproduction, adaptation, and differential reproductive success driven by genetic variation.
source: Explain the process of natural selection and how it contributes to the evolution and adaptation of species.

prompt: ### Human: Implement a binary search algorithm to find a specific element in a sorted array.### Assistant:
system:
Here's an implementation of a binary search algorithm in Python that can be used to find a specific element in a sorted array:

import random

def binary_search(array, target):
    """Performs a binary search on the array to find the target element.

    Args:
        array (list): Array to search through.
        target (int): Target element to find.

    Returns:
        Index of the target element in the array, or -1 if it is not found.
    """
    # Initialize variables
    low = 0
    high = len(array) - 1
    mid = None

    # Binary search loop
    while low <= high:
        mid = (low + high) // 2  # Choose mid point based on the range of the array and the size of the target element. This ensures that the algorithm will not exceed the length of the array when searching for a target element larger than half the size of the array. Note that this is possible due to the use of Python's len() function, which returns the length of an iterable object such as a list. This prevents an index error from occurring when searching for an element larger than half the size of an array. This ensures that only valid indices will be returned by this function. If the target element is found in the middle of the array, it will be returned and no further searching will be required. Otherwise, if it is larger than the middle index, searching will continue until it is smaller than this value and thus can be returned. Otherwise, it is smaller than this value and must be searched for further, continuing until it is found or until searching exceeds the length of the array. This ensures that only valid indices will be returned by this function. By using this method, we are able to efficiently search through an array and find a specific element with O(log n) complexity in time and space, where n is the length of the array.

```
def common_elements(array1, array2):
    """Returns a list of common elements between two arrays."""
    common_elements = []
    for element in array1:
        if element in array2:
            common_elements.append(element)
    return common_elements
```

The earliest form of jazz was known as Dixieland, which featured brass instruments like trumpets and trombones. Over time, jazz evolved into different styles such as swing, bebop, and fusion.

[Slide 3: Cultural Significance of Jazz]

Jazz played a significant role in the civil rights movement of the 1950s and 1960s, as it provided a platform for African American musicians to express their culture and political views. Jazz also helped break down racial barriers in America, as it became popular among all races and cultures. Additionally, jazz has been a source of inspiration for many musicians outside of the genre, including rock stars like John Lennon and The Rolling Stones.

[Slide 4: Impact on Popular Music]

Jazz has had a profound impact on popular music throughout history. Many popular artists have incorporated elements of jazz into their music, such as Miles Davis' fusion of jazz and rock in the 1960s and early 1970s. Additionally, jazz has influenced many genres such as blues, rock, hip hop, and electronic music. Today, jazz continues to be an influential genre that inspires new generations of musicians and fans alike.
source: Write a script for a YouTube video exploring the history and cultural significance of jazz.
